title: `-C target-feature=+crt-static` doesn't work on stable and is silently ignored

labels.name: A-linkage
labels.description: Area: linking into static, shared libraries and binaries

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
`-C target-feature=+crt-static` on stable gives no warning, but the final binary is dynamically linked. This works properly on nightly.

# Steps to reproduce:
## New package
```
$ cargo new static-test
     Created binary (application) `static-test` package
$ cd static-test/
```
## Stable
```
static-test $ rustup default stable
info: using existing install for 'stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu'
info: default toolchain set to 'stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu'

  stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu unchanged - rustc 1.48.0 (7eac88abb 2020-11-16)

static-test $ cargo rustc -- -C target-feature=+crt-static
   Compiling static-test v0.1.0 (/home/havner/devel/rusts/static-test)
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.18s
static-test $ ldd target/debug/static-test
	linux-vdso.so.1 (0x00007fffd47f1000)
	libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgcc_s.so.1 (0x00007fa699ede000)
	libc.so.6 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6 (0x00007fa699aed000)
	/lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x00007fa69a33a000)
	libpthread.so.0 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libpthread.so.0 (0x00007fa6998ce000)
	libdl.so.2 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libdl.so.2 (0x00007fa6996ca000)
```
## Nightly
```
static-test $ rustup default nightly
info: using existing install for 'nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu'
info: default toolchain set to 'nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu'

  nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu unchanged - rustc 1.50.0-nightly (825637983 2020-11-18)

static-test $ cargo rustc -- -C target-feature=+crt-static
   Compiling static-test v0.1.0 (/home/havner/devel/rusts/static-test)
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.20s
static-test $ ldd target/debug/static-test
	not a dynamic executable
```
# Expected result
I'd expect either the final binary to be static on stable or given an error/warning that this option is not supported on stable (as I've seen countless times with other rustc options).
